sentence: Technology stocks were outpacing the broader equity markets in afternoon trade, with shares of tech companies in the S&P 500 consolidating around a 0.5% advance.

In company news, Twitter ( TWTR ) shares tumbled Friday after another would-be buyer was said to have lost interest in acquiring the micro-blogging website although another suitor may be stepping up to take its place, according to reports.

Salesforce.com ( CRM ) reportedly no longer is exploring a deal for Twitter, joining The Walt Disney Co ( DIS ), Apple ( AAPL ) and Google (GOOG,GOOGL) in walking away from the social media company, but ETF Daily News was reporting Japanese technology conglomerate Softbank is considering a deal.

SoftBank also recently partnered with the Saudi Arabia sovereign wealth fund to create a $25 billion technology investment pool, providing it with the means to bid for Twitter, according to the Financial Times.
TWTR shares were down over 5% in late trade at $16.63 apiece, earlier sinking to a session low of $16.28 a share.
CRM shares turned sharply higher this afternoon, reversing a mid-day decline, and still were up more than 6% at $74.91 each shortly before today's closing bell.
(+) NEON, Signs contract valued at more than $11 mln to supply zForce AIR sensor modules to an unnamed U.S. automotive original equipment manufacturer.
(-) SMSI, Lowers Q3 revenue forecast to $6.5 mln, down from its prior outlook expecting between $7.9 mln to $8.4 mln in quarterly revenue and trailing the $8.20 mln two-analyst estimate.
